subject: Add power_state implementation
commitMessage:
Add power_state implementation

Added power_state implementation for multi host platform
specific shutdown interfaces like hard shutdown or soft
shutdown interfaces.

Getting the current host state of all the hosts and set
power_state values based on the hosts current host state.

TESTED : Verified the Shutdown alarms trigged and platform
specific actions done in Facebook YosemiteV2 platform.

Signed-off-by: Kumar Thangavel <thangavel.k@hcl.com>
Change-Id: I5e38bb9f28b7840c9de10082905b31deb8ffc4ff

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 2dd87bd16dd687149a7c870f01d26ab34b9842c4
If you look in sdbusplus.hpp it has a GetSubTree wrapper that may be useful here.
how is this getting set before readHostState is called?
We have multi hosts for our platform. So only, not added static path by default. The path is getting by GetSubTree. Is there any way to use only interface in propertiesChanged ?

You can use the rules::propertiesChangedNamespace() (https://github.com/openbmc/sdbusplus/blob/master/include/sdbusplus/bus/match.hpp#L201) to be able to match on paths within some namespace, like /xyz/openbmc_project/state/host/
const std::string& or const auto&  would be better
The host state enums have more than just Running and Off.  Is that possible with your code?
You also have this below on 369. I don't think it needs to be a class member?
Ack. We can use the class member instead of the new variable "hostIntfs"
if you did something like [path, services]  here instead I think it would be easier to read.
here could do:  (const auto& [serviceName, interfaces] : services)  or something like that
is there a reason you can't just do a == here?  do you have more than 1 host service?
Yes. We have more than one host service. multi hosts.

since you already found the service with GetSubTree I don't think it's possible to get a DbusServiceError here.  You could still catch a sdbusplus::exception::exception here or nothing at all if you wanted.
Ack. I will remove the try catch as DbusServiceError handled in GetSubTree.
how would this get set?  Usually people add these with the --enable options in configure.ac

This is set in Machine layer, bbappend file. 
"EXTRA_OEMAKE += "HOSTSTATE=1"
Do you need to worry about some hosts being on while others are off?  Looks like now you'd always get the answer of the last host.

Agree. It's enable powerState only for last host.

Shall we set powerState as true if any one of the host is ON or Running ? Please suggest.

A few questions so I can understand your situation:

You want to power off all the hosts at once, right, and not just the host with the over-threshold sensors?

Is there any reason the hosts could have different power states for any significant amount of time?

And a follow on, is there a case where a sensor from a powered off host could go over-threshold and cause a power off of the hosts that are on?

Matt : You want to power off all the hosts at once, right, and not just the host with the over-threshold sensors?

Kumar : Yes. I want to power off all the hosts at once. We have Fan sensors for entire chassis and monitoring the fan sensor and power off all the hosts if fan sensors value goes below threshold to avoid over heating/temperature in the chassis. 

We don't have fan sensor for each hosts. It is not related to any particular hosts. That's the reason, I wanted to power off all the hosts at once.

Matt : Is there any reason the hosts could have different power states for any significant amount of time?

Kumar:  We have power control options. User can do power on/off the hosts. So, It can be controlled by user for some time.

Matt : Is there a case where a sensor from a powered off host could go over-threshold and cause a power off of the hosts that are on?

Kumar : This is not related to any particular hosts. So, We power off the all the hosts at once. It's irrespective of host sensors.
OK, in that case then it seems like you'd want the host state to be true if any host state is on?
Yes. Host state should be true if any host is on.
don't think you need any of these new includes?
const std::vector<std::string>&    is preferred for vectors

'hostStateService' to make it camelCase

also, do you really need the .c_str()?

missing a leading '/' here?

you also may need a trailing '/' to get it to work in propertiesChangedNamespace.  Were you able to test it works?

Done. The multi host path like host1, host2, host3 and host4 is not working with propertiesChangedNamespace. So, updated them using only with interfaces. So, the callback will execute if any properties changed in any one of the D-bus paths.

Hi All,

Could you please review this patch and provide your comments if any

Thanks,
Kumar.

Does it matter to your use case if setPowerState(false) gets called a few times in this function before setPowerStateTrue does?  Also depending on which host is the one that is on, it may affect how many setPowerState(false)s get called.

Would it work if you just used vars to track the power states in the loop and  then called setPowerState() appropriately at the end?

do these power states cover the whole possible list?  If so, maybe just default the flag to false, and check for the 'On' case. that means less chance of missing a new enum value that someone adds.  But if you'd just rather keep this I'm OK with it.
Yes. These are the possible states. I will update the flag to false as default and  check only for "On" case.
you could remove this whole leg if you wanted

Is there a reason you're not using sdbusplus::bus::match::rules ?

This match looks to me like it matches on way too many items.  Don't we have a path and/or namespace to match on?  How are you going to support multi-host when you don't have an instance you are matching on?

I initially used with sdbusplus::bus::match::rules::propertiesChanged and sdbusplus::bus::match::rules::propertiesChangedNamespace. 

But, the multi host path like host1, host2, host3 and host4 is not working with propertiesChangedNamespace and propertiesChanged. So, updated them using only with interfaces. So, the callback will execute if any properties changed in any one of these D-bus paths.
What did you try for propertiesChangedNamespace?  We should get to the bottom of this so that we're not sending almost all PropertiesChanged signals at the daemon.

1. You need to add a leading /.
2. Namespace doesn't mean "pattern"; it is more like a directory.  You want just `/xyz/openbmc_project/state`.  You won't be able to filter by the 'host' prefix.

See https://dbus.freedesktop.org/doc/dbus-specification.html#message-bus-routing-match-rules where it says:

> For example, path_namespace='/com/example/foo' would match signals sent by /com/example/foo or by /com/example/foo/bar, but not by /com/example/foobar.

Ack. Thanks for your suggestions. 

I tired with leading /. 
const std::string _hostStatePath{"/xyz/openbmc_project/state/host"};

I have updated here with incorrect hostStatePath.

I will try with `/xyz/openbmc_project/state` and as per instructions.
Can you switch this code to properly use the 'from_string' method rather than doing your own string matching?
Do you suggest from_string from boost ? Could you please provide any sample code reference for this ?
Please switch this to use a PDI enumeration rather than a string.
Doesn't this turn it on for everyone?  I suspect this isn't what you intented.
No. This is turn on only if it is enabled in machine layer (HOSTSTATE=1).
How?  The way I read this is that "-DENABLE_HOST_STATE" is always passed to the compiler.  I don't see any conditional here because ENABLE_HOST_STATE is a local variable that is never evaluated.
if you're going to add a --enable option, you need to use AC_ARG_ENABLE, like up above

I think you were mentioning issues with propertiesChangedNamespace working?  Someone submitted a fix for it today.  Would be good to confirm this code still works as you expect with the sdbusplus change.

https://github.com/openbmc/sdbusplus/commit/7662fa6932c90c134ecc815be688957fa45e1c84

I have checked with this new commit, propertiesChangedNamespace is working with D-bus path "/xyz/openbmc_project/state". 

As per this reference, the dbus path has to be "/xyz/openbmc_project/state"
https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-virtual-sensor/blob/1204b43374720e9b338ea0aa6be75d8d27e0477e/virtualSensor.cpp#L718.

You don't need to write this yourself.  If you look in the sdbusplus generated server.hpp/cpp for this in phosphor-dbus-interfaces, you'll see:

        /** @brief Convert a string to an appropriate enum value.
         *  @param[in] s - The string to convert in the form of
         *                 "xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host.<value name>"
         *  @return - The enum value.
         *
         *  @note Throws if string is not a valid mapping.
         */
        static HostState convertHostStateFromString(const std::string& s);
And `getProperty<Host::HostState>` here.  The dbus code already handles unpacking an enum-type correctly.
Isn't Standby and Quiesced also indicating power is on?  Is anything except 'Off' mean powered on?  'TransitioningToOff' seems like the only questionable one.

Ack. I am also having doubtful in adding these states for power on. 

I will go ahead with adding Standby and Quiesced states for power on. 
It seems 'TransitioningToOff' state is for off. 

Reviewers/MAINTAINERS, Could you please suggest or confirm about this.
Seems to me like you have it right now.

Hi All, 

  Could you please provide your comments if any or provide your approval.

Thanks,
Kumar.
heh at this point it would almost be easier to have inverted the check and just looked for not powered off.
I dont see the need for this?
`getSubTree` will log an error when the response is empty, perhaps `getSubTreeRaw` should be used here instead?
